history.content: You can just leave it as "not available" if you don't know what your grade from Spring 2020 was. We can look it up. If you want to do something special like swap one class out and use another or have us ignore something, send us an e-mail at cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu and we can put those instructions in your file for the person who handles your declaration. Otherwise, we just go through the applications and calculate what will give each of you the best possible outcome and go from there.

What should we put if we choose to use P as the grade for those courses in sp20 to declare cs, since there is no option for "P"?_____2020-12-07_15.09.57.png

And, since sp20 has the different policy that we can use EECS 16B instead of CS70 to declare, then if we are taking EECS 16B this semester, should we put "not available yet" as the grade for CS70?

For the Proposed Schedule, since there is no option for previous semesters, we just need to put the courses that we are taking and plan to take, but no need to put the courses that we have taken including Tech Elective, correct?_____2020-12-07_15.08.47.png
history.subject: Grade of sp20 on declare application form
